about.paragraph1: Rooted in the heart of Cilento, our team has spent years exploring every corner of this magical land. From the ancient Greek temples of Paestum to the hidden coves along the Mediterranean coast, we know Cilento like the back of our hand.
about.paragraph2: What started as sharing favorite local spots with friends has grown into a passion for creating unforgettable travel experiences. We believe that travel should be more than sightseeing—it should be about connection, culture, and creating memories that last a lifetime.
about.paragraph3: Every experience we offer is personally curated, from meeting the buffalo mozzarella makers at dawn to sharing home-cooked meals with local families. We can't wait to share our Cilento with you.

faq.contactCta: Still have questions? We're here to help!

items.question: What is included in your travel packages?
items.answer: Our packages typically include accommodation, guided tours, transportation within Cilento, meals as specified in the itinerary, and all entrance fees to attractions. We also provide 24/7 support during your stay. Each package details exactly what's included, and we can customize based on your preferences.

items.question: How do I book a Roots Holiday to find my ancestral town?
items.answer: Start by contacting us with any information you have about your Italian ancestors—names, approximate dates, and the region or town if known. We'll conduct preliminary research and create a personalized itinerary. Teresa has extensive experience with genealogical records and local archives.

items.question: What is the best time to visit Cilento?
items.answer: Cilento is beautiful year-round! Spring (April-May) offers mild weather and blooming wildflowers. Summer (June-August) is perfect for beach activities and festivals. Fall (September-October) is ideal for wine harvests and fewer crowds. Winter provides a peaceful, authentic local experience.

items.question: Do you offer private tours for small groups?
items.answer: Absolutely! Most of our experiences are designed for small groups of 2-8 people to ensure personalization. We can also arrange completely private tours for couples, families, or friend groups. Just let us know your preferences when booking.

items.question: What languages do your guides speak?
items.answer: Teresa is fluent in Italian and English. We also have guides who speak German and Spanish. For other languages, we can arrange translation services with advance notice.

items.question: Can you accommodate dietary restrictions?
items.answer: Yes, we work closely with our restaurant partners and hosts to accommodate all dietary needs—vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, allergies, etc. Just inform us when booking, and we'll ensure every meal is enjoyable and safe for you.

items.question: What is your cancellation policy?
items.answer: We offer flexible cancellation: full refund for cancellations 30+ days before the trip, 50% refund for 15-29 days, and credit for future travel for cancellations within 14 days. We understand plans can change and work with you to find the best solution.

items.question: How do I get to Cilento?
items.answer: The easiest way is to fly into Naples International Airport (NAP). We can arrange airport transfers to your accommodation in Cilento (about 1.5 hours). Alternatively, you can take a train to Salerno and we'll pick you up from there.
